newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Man Yue Int'l to issue 55 mln new shares in IPO.
newsitem.headline: Man Yue Int'l to issue 55 mln new shares in IPO.

text.p: Hong Kong capacitors and resistors trader Man Yue International Holdings Ltd said on Monday it would issue 55 million new shares, or 25 percent of its enlarged share capital, at HK$1.08 each in a public offer.
Man Yue said it would have market capitalisation of HK$237 million and adjustable net tangilble assest value of HK$0.543 per share.

The issue price of HK$1.08 represents a price earnings ratio of 5.1 times on a weighted average basis and 6.4 times on a proforma fully diluted basis. The prospective dividened yield is seven percent, it said.
The initial public offer would be from February 18 to 21. Dealing in the shares is expected to begin on the Stock Exchange of Hong Kong on March 5.
